member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.IEditableText
member.summary: Represents a control with text display and edit semantics.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IEditableText.Text
member.summary: The text being displayed or edited by the control.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.IEditableText.TextChanged
member.summary: Raised when the text is changed via the user interface.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource
member.summary: Represents an object that can initiate a drag operation and provide the associated data object. This interface allows the source to monitor the progress of the drag operation it initiates.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource.OnDragStart(System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies the drag source of the start of the drag/drop operation.
member.param: Any context information passed to the DragDropManager along with the drag/drop operation.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource.OnDrag(System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies the drag source as the drag/drop operation continues.
member.param: Any context information passed to the DragDropManager along with the drag/drop operation.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource.OnDragEnd(System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies the drag source of the end of the drag/drop operation.
member.param: Whether the drag/drop operation was canceled.
Any context information passed to the DragDropManager along with the drag/drop operation.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource.DOMElement
member.summary: Retrieves the DOM element associated with the source. This is used to align the top-left corner of the drag visual.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData
member.summary: Encapsulates information about the data being dragged.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData.EnableDataTransfer
member.summary: Whether to enable data transfer of the data object.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData.Mode
member.summary: The type of drag/drop operation.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData.DataType
member.summary: The type of the data being dragged.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData.Data
member.summary: The data being dragged.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData.#ctor(ScriptFX.UI.DragMode,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a DragDropData instance with the supplied information about the data, its type, and the type of drag operation to perform.
member.param: The type of drag/drop operation.
The data type of the object being dragged.
The data being dragged.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.JSON
member.summary: JSON is a utility class to provide serialization and deserialization of object graphs to/from JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format. JSON is a data format. In other words, the serialized state does not contain type information. It only contains data. Therefore the object graph being serialized should not contain custom types. The only allowable types are JavaScript intrinsic types (Object, Array, String, Boolean, Number, and Date).

member.name: M:ScriptFX.JSON.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes an object graph represented by the specified JSON string.
member.param: The serialized object graph.
member.returns: The deserialized object graph.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.JSON.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes the specified object graph into its equivalent JSON string representation.
member.param: The object graph to serialize.
member.returns: The serialized JSON representation.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.IEventManager
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for loosely coupled event publishing and subscribing. Each event is associated with a unique type or name. Subscribers can register for events, and publishers can raise events. An event manager routes events without requiring the publisher and subscriber to know about each other.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.IEventManager.RaiseEvent(System.String,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Allows an event publisher to raise an event.
member.param: The unique name of the event.
The event publisher.
Any information associated with the event.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.IEventManager.RegisterEvent(System.String,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Allows an event publisher to raise an event, and at the same time indicate that the event manager should save the event and automatically raise it should a subscriber register to handle it at a later time.
member.param: The unique name of the event.
The event publisher.
Any information associated with the event.
member.returns: A cookie that should be used to unregister the event.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.IEventManager.RegisterEventHandler(System.String,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Allows an event subscriber to register an event handler to be invoked whenever an event of the specified type is raised.
member.param: The unique name of the event.
The handler to be invoked when the event occurs.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.IEventManager.UnregisterEvent(System.Object)
member.summary: Unregisters an event previously registered with the event manager.
member.param: The registration cookie.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.IEventManager.UnregisterEventHandler(System.String,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Allows an event subscriber to unregister an event handler that has been registered to handle an event of the specified type.
member.param: The unique name of the event.
The handler registered to be invoked when the event occurs.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest
member.summary: Encapsulates information for communicating with a server in order to send data to the server, or recieve data from the server.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the request, and ignores any response that might have resulted.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.CreateRequest(System.String,ScriptFX.Net.HTTPVerb)
member.summary: Creates a new HTTPRequest to the endpoint specified by the URI. The URI can be a simple string, in which case the default HTTP transport, i.e. XMLHttp is used. The URI can also be a serialized JSON object containing two fields: a string 'uri' and a Type 'transportType'. This allows selecting a custom transport to be used to perform the request. The URI can be constructed programmatically via the HTTPTransport.CreateURI method.
member.param: The URI representing the server endpoint.
The HTTP verb to be used for the request.
member.returns: An HTTPRequest object for use to communicate with the server.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.CreateURI(System.String,System.Dictionary)
member.summary: Creates a URI with the specific base URI, appended with the specified name/value pairs.
member.param: The base URI.
The set of name/value pairs to add.
member.returns: The URI with parameters added as query string variables.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes an HTTPRequest instance.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Invoke(ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestCompletedCallback)
member.summary: Initiates the communication with the server.
member.param: The callback to invoke upon completion of the request.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Invoke(ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestCompletedCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates the communication with the server.
member.param: The callback to invoke upon completion of the request.
An optional context object to be passed to the callback.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.SetContentAsForm(System.Dictionary)
member.summary: Sets the request body to the form encoded representation of the specified data. The content type of the request is also set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
member.param: The dictionary representing the request body.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.SetContentAsJSON(System.Dictionary)
member.summary: Sets the request body to the JSON serialized representation of the specified data. The content type of the request is also set to text/json.
member.param: The dictionary representing the request body.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.SetCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the user name and password of the credentials to use to authenticate the request.
member.param: The user name within the credential.
The password within the credential.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Content
member.summary: Any content associated with the request sent as part of the request body. This is only valid in the context of requests using the POST HTTP verb.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.HasCredentials
member.summary: Returns true if the request has been associated with custom credentials.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.HasHeaders
member.summary: Returns true if the request has been associated with custom request headers.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Headers
member.summary: The set of request headers to be sent along with the request.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Password
member.summary: The password to use to authenticate the request.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Response
member.summary: The response generated by the server. This is only valid when the request has successfully completed.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.State
member.summary: The current state of the request.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Timeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds after which to time out this request. Setting this value to non-zero overrides the default in HTTPRequestManager.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time stamp recorded when the request was issued.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.TransportType
member.summary: The type of transport to use to issue the request. The specified transport type must implement the IHTTPTransport interface.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.URI
member.summary: The URI representing the server endpoint to be used for communication.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.UserName
member.summary: The user name to use to authenticate the request.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequest.Verb
member.summary: The HTTP verb to be used in the communication.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions
member.summary: A set of options to customize the behavior of the PopupBehavior.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.id
member.summary: The name of the PopupBehavior to expose it as a top-level property of the element that the Behavior is associated with.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.referenceElement
member.summary: The element used as a reference element for positioning the popup.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.mode
member.summary: The type of positioning used to position the popup.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.xOffset
member.summary: The x offset used in positioning the popup.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.yOffset
member.summary: The y offset used in positioning the popup.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a PopupOptions object with the required set of properties.
member.param: The element used as a reference element for positioning the popup.
The type of positioning used to position the popup.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.Control
member.summary: A control is a special type of behavior. Unlike other behavior types, only one Control behavior can be associated with a DOM element. It can be thought of as a "primary" behavior, while other behaviors associated with the same DOM element can be thought of as "secondary" behaviors. The fact that a control is a primary behavior manifests itself in various ways: - The ID of a control, which is used as an expando on the DOM element is always "control". - When the control behavior is disposed, it disposes every other behavior associated with the element. - When the control behavior is disposed, it raises a disposing notification. Any objects that are dependent on the life-time of script objects associated with a DOM element can now subscribe to the control behavior's disposing event.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior
member.summary: A behavior represents an extension to an intrinsic DOM element, implemented via script. A behavior can expose an object model that allows it to provide a higher level abstraction over its associated DOM element. A DOM element may have one or more associated behaviors.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.ISupportInitialize
member.summary: Allows an object to provide batch updating/initialization semantics, where a number of individual changes can be made and processed at once. Usually this is done for performance reasons, to avoid the cost of processing property changes one at a time, but it can also be used to implement dependent properties.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.ISupportInitialize.BeginInitialize
member.summary: Starts a batch initialization.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.ISupportInitialize.EndInitialize
member.summary: Ends the current batch initialization. Any changes made during the batch should now be processed.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a behavior and associates it with the specified DOM element. If an id is provided, an expando with the given value is added to the element to provide an easy reference to the behavior instance. The ID should be unique with respect to the specific DOM element.
member.param: The associated DOM element.
The id of the behavior (optional).

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.BeginInitialize
member.summary: Starts a batched initialization, wherein changes to the behavior's state are not processed until EndInitialize is called.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes a behavior and disassociates it from its DOM element. It is recommended you call this before you programmatically remove DOM elements from the document. If not explicitly called, the framework ensures this is called when the document is unloaded by the browser.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.EndInitialize
member.summary: Ends a batched initialization, which indicates to the behavior to go ahead and process any state changes made during the batch.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.GetBehavior(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets an instance of a type of behavior associated with the specified DOM element, if there is one.
member.param: The DOM element with which the behavior is associated.
The type of behavior to look up.
member.returns: The behavior instance if one exists; null otherwise.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.GetBehaviors(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.Type)
member.summary: Retrieves the collection of behaviors associated with the specified DOM element. The collection is in arbitrary order. If a type is also specified then only matching behaviors are returned.
member.param: The DOM element with which the behavior is associated.
An optional type to filter the set of behaviors.
member.returns: The set of behaviors if there are any; null otherwise.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.GetNamedBehavior(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an instance of a behavior with the given ID associated with the specified DOM element, if there is one. A behavior's ID is set when it is created by passing it into the constructor of the behavior.
member.param: The DOM element with which the behavior is associated.
The ID of the behavior.
member.returns: The behavior instance if one exists; null otherwise.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Raises a property changed notification for the specified property.
member.param: The name of the property that has changed.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.DOMElement
member.summary: The DOM element associated with the behavior.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.DOMEvents
member.summary: The set of event handlers attached to the associated DOM element.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.Events
member.summary: The set of event handlers for events exposed by the behavior.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.IsDisposed
member.summary: Whether the behavior has been disposed, i.e. it has been detached from the DOM element it was associated with.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.IsInitializing
member.summary: Whether the behavior is in the middle of a batch initialization, and processing state changes should be postponed.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.Behavior.PropertyChanged
member.summary: An event to indicate a change in a property value.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.INotifyDisposing
member.summary: Allows an object to notify other objects that it is in the process of being disposed. It allows consumers of the notification to access the object's state safely before it is disposed, as well as to dispose themselves if they are dependent objects.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.INotifyDisposing.Disposing
member.summary: Raised when the object is being disposed.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Control.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a control and associates it with the specified DOM element.
member.param: The associated DOM element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Control.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the control associated with a DOM element. In addition to dispoosing itself, a control also is responsible for disposing all other behaviors associated with the same DOM element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Control.GetControl(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the control associated with the DOM element if there is one.
member.param: The DOM element with which the control is associated.
member.returns: The control associated with the DOM element; null if there is none.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.Control.Disposing
member.summary: Raised when the object is being disposed.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about drag/drop operations.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropEventArgs.DataObject
member.summary: Information about the current drag/drop operation.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationEasingFunction
member.summary: A delegate used to define an easing function that can be used to vary the otherwise normal linear progression of an animation from its start state to end state. An easing function is basically f(t) where t = [0...1] such that it is continuous and f(0) == 0 and f(1) == 1. Easing functions can be used to add the illusion of acceleration and deceleration, as well as other sophisticated movement patterns.
member.param: The current progress value derived from linear progression.
member.returns: The modified value to use as the new progress value.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.HistoryEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a delegate that handles history events.
member.param: The sender of the event.
The history information associated with the event.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode
member.summary: The type of popup positioning.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.Center
member.summary: Centered with respect to a reference element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AnchorTopLeft
member.summary: Anchors the popup to the top-left corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AnchorTopRight
member.summary: Anchors the popup to the top-right corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AnchorBottomRight
member.summary: Anchors the popup to the bottom-right corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AnchorBottomLeft
member.summary: Anchors the popup to the bottom-left corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AlignTopLeft
member.summary: Aligns the popup to the top-left corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AlignTopRight
member.summary: Aligns the popup to the top-right corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AlignBottomRight
member.summary: Aligns the popup to the bottom-right corner of referenced element.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.PopupMode.AlignBottomLeft
member.summary: Aligns the popup to the bottom-left corner of referenced element.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior
member.summary: A behavior that can be used to place an overlay (typically a translucent one) over the document.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.OverlayOptions)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a OverlayBehavior.
member.param: The element to associated with this behavior.
The options used to customize the behavior.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the PopupBehavior instance and disassociate it with its DOM element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.Hide
member.summary: Hides the element associated with the PopupBehavior.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.Show
member.summary: Shows the element associated with the PopupBehavior.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.IsVisible
member.summary: Whether the overlay is currently visible.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayBehavior.VisibilityChanged
member.summary: Raised when the overlay becomes fully visible or invisible. This is useful when using animated fade in and fade out of the overlay.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.FadeEffect
member.summary: Fades an element in or out. This can be used to smoothly hide or show an element.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation
member.summary: The base class for all animations that are associated with time characteristics such as a duration, number of repetitions, easing behavior etc.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.Animation
member.summary: The base class for all animations that can be scheduled, managed and executed via the centralized AnimationManager.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Creates and initializes an instance of an Animation class with the specified DOM element. If an element is not specified, the root documentElement is used.
member.param: The DOM element to associate the animation with.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the animation instance.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.PerformCleanup
member.summary: Allows the animation to perform any cleanup work once the animation is complete.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.PerformRepetition(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows the animation to perform any work it needs to do so between successive repetitions.
member.param: Whether the next repetition will take place in revered manner.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.PerformSetup
member.summary: Allows the animation to perform any setup work before the animation is started.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the animation immediately.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.PlayCore
member.summary: Plays the animation when it is scheduled for playing by the AnimationManager.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.ProgressCore(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Progresses the animation to the new current time.
member.param: Whether the animation is starting a repetition.
The time stamp to progress the animation through.
member.returns: Whether the animation has completed.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Stop(ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState)
member.summary: Stops playing the animation mid-way. The specified stopState determines the state in which the element being animated is left in.
member.param: The state of the element upon stopping the animation.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.StopCore(System.Boolean,ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState)
member.summary: Stops the animation when it is removed from the AnimationManager's scheduled animations.
member.param: Whether the animation has completed naturally.
The state in which the animation should end if it was interrupted.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Repeating
member.summary: Raised before the animation is repeated. This event can be used to cancel further repeatitions.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Starting
member.summary: Raised before the animation is started and performs any setup work.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Stopped
member.summary: Raised after the animation is stopped or completed, and any cleanup work has been performed.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.AutoReverse
member.summary: Whether an animation automatically plays in the reverse direction upon repeating.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Completed
member.summary: True if the animation has completely finished playing without being stopped mid-way.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.DOMElement
member.summary: The DOM element that this animation is associated with.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.IsPlaying
member.summary: Whether the animation is currently playing or not.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.IsReversed
member.summary: Whether the animation is currently playing in the reverse direction.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.RepeatCount
member.summary: Whether the animation repeats or plays a single time. 0 implies implies endless repetition, and other positive values indicate a fixed number of repetitions. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.RepeatDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to delay the animation between successive repetitions.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.Animation.Repetitions
member.summary: Returns the number of repeatitions of the animation completed so far.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and initializes an animation for the specified duration (in milliseconds).
member.param: The DOM element to associate the animation with.
The time span over which the animation executes.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.EaseIn(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates the illusion of an animation that starts slow and speeds up.
member.param: The current progress value derived from linear progression.
member.returns: The modified value to use as the new progress value.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.EaseInOut(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates the illusion of an animation that starts slow and speeds up, and then slows down to a stop.
member.param: The current progress value derived from linear progression.
member.returns: The modified value to use as the new progress value.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.EaseOut(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates the illusion of an animation that starts fast and slows down to a stop.
member.param: The current progress value derived from linear progression.
member.returns: The modified value to use as the new progress value.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.PerformTweening(System.Single)
member.summary: Allows the animation to implement its core logic of generating intermediate frames as it progresses from start to end.
member.param: A value between 0 and 1 (inclusive) indicating the current frame.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.PlayCore
member.summary: Plays the animation when it is scheduled for playing by the AnimationManager.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.ProgressCore(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Progresses the animation to the new current time.
member.param: Whether the animation is starting a repetition.
The time stamp to progress the animation through.
member.returns: Whether the animation has completed.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.StopCore(System.Boolean,ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState)
member.summary: Stops the animation when it is removed from the AnimationManager's scheduled animations.
member.param: Whether the animation has completed naturally.
The state in which the animation should end if it was interrupted.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.Duration
member.summary: The duration of time (in milliseconds) that this animation plays over.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.TimedAnimation.EasingFunction
member.summary: The easing function used to ease the normal linear progression of the animation from the start to end state.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.FadeEffect.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a fade effect.
member.param: The element to fade in or out.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.FadeEffect.FadeIn
member.summary: Fade the element in.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.FadeEffect.FadeOut
member.summary: Fade the element out.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.FadeEffect.IsFadingIn
member.summary: Whether the animation is fading in the element or fading it out.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager
member.summary: The global drag/drop manager that manages drag and drop functionality on the page. It is used to initiate drag/drop operations in response to user actions. It manages the set of registered drop targets, and is associates with a specific drag/drop implementation based on the browser.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.RegisterDragDropImplementation(ScriptFX.UI.IDragDrop)
member.summary: Enables drag/drop operations on the page using the specified drag/drop implementation.
member.param: The drag/drop implementation to use.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.RegisterDropTarget(ScriptFX.UI.IDropTarget)
member.summary: Registers a drop target, that is to be included in the list of potential containers for a dragged object.
member.param: The drop target being registered.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.StartDragDrop(ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData,System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.Location,ScriptFX.UI.IDragSource,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a drag/drop operation.
member.param: The data being dragged.
An element used to provide visual indication of the data being dragged.
The offset between the top-left corner of the object being dragged, and from where the drag operation was initiated.
The source of the drag/drop if the source desires tracking the progress of the operation (optional).
A context object passed to the drag source while the drag/drop operation continues (optional).
member.returns: Whether the drag/drop operation is taking place.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.UnregisterDropTarget(ScriptFX.UI.IDropTarget)
member.summary: Unregisters a drop target, so that it is no longer included in the list of potential containers for dragged objects.
member.param: The drop target being unregistered.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.CanDragDrop
member.summary: Whether drag/drop operations are allowed on the page.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.SupportsDataTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether the drag/drop operations support data transfer across applications.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.DragDropEnding
member.summary: Raised before a drag/drop operation is complete. This is raised even if the drag/drop operation is canceled.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.DragDropManager.DragDropStarting

member.name: T:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse
member.summary: Represents a response associated with an HTTP request.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.GetHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified header.
member.param: The name of the header.
member.returns: The associated value; null if there is no such header in the response.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.GetObject
member.summary: Gets the response as an object. The object is created by deserializing the response text.
member.returns: The deserialized object.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.GetText
member.summary: Gets the raw response text.
member.returns: The response text.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.GetXML
member.summary: Gets the response as an XML document.
member.returns: The XML document.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the response content.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.ContentType
member.summary: The mime type associated with the response content.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.Headers
member.summary: The set of HTTP headers sent along with the response.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.Request
member.summary: The request that was invoked to result in this response.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code associated with the response.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.StatusText
member.summary: The textual description associated with the status.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.IHTTPResponse.TimeStamp
member.summary: Indicates when the response was recieved on the client.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.EventList
member.summary: EventList is a utility class to manage a set of event handlers for events exposed by a class. EventList allows the class to expose several events, without incurring the overhead of several null fields on the class instance, when it is uncommon to have subscribers for all events. To manage event handlers, each event is associated with a key, which is usually the name of the event in the class' object model.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.EventList.AddHandler(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Adds a handler for the specified event.
member.param: The key used to identify the event.
The event handler to add.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.EventList.GetHandler(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the handler for the specified event. If there are multiple handlers associated with the event, a multicast delegate is returned, which transparently multicasts the event to all handlers.
member.param: The key used to identify the event.
member.returns: A delegate representing the handler(s) associated with the event; null if there are none.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.EventList.RemoveHandler(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Removes a handler for the specified event.
member.param: The key used to identify the event.
The event handler to remove.
member.returns: true if there are handlers remaining for the specified event; false otherwise.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.Element
member.summary: A set of utility operations associated with DOM elements.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.AddCSSClass(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified CSS class to the set of CSS classes associated with the element.
member.param: The element to update.
The CSS class to add.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.ContainsCSSClass(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for the existence of the specified CSS class in the set of CSS classes associated with the element.
member.param: The element to update.
The CSS class to lookup.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.GetBounds(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the location and size of the element.
member.param: The element to locate and measure.
member.returns: The left, top, width and height values of the element's bounds.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.GetLocation(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the location of the element.
member.param: The element to locate.
member.returns: The left and top values of the element's location.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.GetSize(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the element.
member.param: The element to measure.
member.returns: The width and height values of the element's dimensions.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.RemoveCSSClass(System.DHTML.DOMElement,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified CSS class from the set of CSS classes associated with the element.
member.param: The element to update.
The CSS class to remove.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.SetLocation(System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.Location)
member.summary: Updates the location of the element.
member.param: The element to update.
The new location of the element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.Element.SetSize(System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.Size)
member.summary: Updates the size of the element.
member.param: The element to measure.
The new size of the element.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState
member.summary: Used to indicate the final state of an element being animated when the the animation is stopped mid-way.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState.Complete
member.summary: Leaves the animated element in its intended final state.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState.Abort
member.summary: Leaves the element in its current state.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationStopState.Revert
member.summary: Leaves the element back in its original state.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of status codes defined for HTTP.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.CanContinue
member.summary: HTTP status 100 indicates that the client can continue with its request.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: HTTP status 101 indicates that the protocol version or protocol is being changed.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.OK
member.summary: HTTP status 200 indicates that the request succeeded and that the requested information is in the response. This is the most common status code to receive.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Created
member.summary: HTTP status 201 indicates that the request resulted in a new resource created before the response was sent.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: HTTP status 206 indicates that the response is a partial response as requested by a GET request that includes a byte range.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: HTTP status 202 indicates that the request has been accepted for further processing.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: HTTP status 203 indicates that the returned metainformation is from a cached copy instead of the origin server and therefore may be incorrect.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: HTTP status 204 indicates that the request has been successfully processed and that the response is intentionally blank.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: HTTP status 205 indicates that the client should reset (not reload) the current resource.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Ambiguous
member.summary: HTTP status 300 indicates that the requested information has multiple representations.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Moved
member.summary: HTTP status 301 indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Redirect
member.summary: HTTP status 302 indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.RedirectMethod
member.summary: HTTP status 303 automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: HTTP status 304 indicates that the client's cached copy is up to date. The contents of the resource are not transferred.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: HTTP status 305 indicates that the request should use the proxy server at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary: HTTP status 307 indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: HTTP status 400 indicates that the request could not be understood by the server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: HTTP status 400 indicates that the request method (POST or GET) is not allowed on the requested resource.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: HTTP status 401 indicates that the requested resource requires authentication. The WWW-Authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: HTTP status 402 is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: HTTP status 403 indicates that the server refuses to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: HTTP status 404 indicates that the requested resource does not exist on the server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: HTTP status 406 indicates that the client has indicated with Accept headers that it will not accept any of the available representations of the resource.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: HTTP status 407 indicates that the requested proxy requires authentication. The Proxy-authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: HTTP status 408 indicates that the client did not send a request within the time the server was expecting the request.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: HTTP status 409 indicates that the request could not be carried out because of a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: HTTP status 410 indicates that the requested resource is no longer available.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: HTTP status 411 indicates that the required Content-length header is missing.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: HTTP status 412 indicates that a condition set for this request failed, and the request cannot be carried out. Conditions are set with conditional request headers like If-Match, If-None-Match, or If-Unmodified-Since.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: HTTP status 413 indicates that the request is too large for the server to process.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: HTTP status 414 indicates that the URI is too long.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: HTTP status 415 indicates that the request is an unsupported type.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: HTTP status 416 indicates that the range of data requested from the resource cannot be returned, either because the beginning of the range is before the beginning of the resource, or the end of the range is after the end of the resource.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: HTTP status 417 indicates that an expectation given in an Expect header could not be met by the server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: HTTP status 500 indicates that a generic error has occurred on the server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: HTTP status 501 indicates that the server does not support the requested function.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: HTTP status 502 indicates that an intermediate proxy server received a bad response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: HTTP status 503 indicates that the server is temporarily unavailable, usually due to high load or maintenance.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: HTTP status 504 indicates that an intermediate proxy server timed out while waiting for a response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: HTTP status 505 indicates that the requested HTTP version is not supported by the server.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager
member.summary: The HTTPRequestManager object manages all out-going HTTP requests.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager.AbortAll
member.summary: Aborts all currently active HTTP requests.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager.RequestInvoking
member.summary: The event raised before an HTTP request is issued. You can subscribe to this event to track requests, as well as suppress requests.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager.RequestInvoked
member.summary: The event raised once an HTTP request has been completed (or aborted or timed out). You can subscribe to this event to track requests, and peek at responses.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager.Online
member.summary: Indicates if the network is online, and HTTP requests can be issued.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.Net.HTTPRequestManager.TimeoutInterval
member.summary: The default time out for all HTTP requests. By default this is 0, i.e. there is no enforced time out.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.PopupBehavior
member.summary: A behavior that can be associated with an element to show or hide it in a popup style.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.PopupBehavior.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement,ScriptFX.UI.PopupOptions)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a PopupBehavior.
member.param: The element to associated with this behavior.
The options used to customize the behavior.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.PopupBehavior.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the PopupBehavior instance and disassociate it with its DOM element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.PopupBehavior.Hide
member.summary: Hides the element associated with the PopupBehavior.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.PopupBehavior.Show
member.summary: Shows the element associated with the PopupBehavior.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.IValidator

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IValidator.ValidationGroup
member.summary: The logical validation group that this validator belongs to.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.IAction
member.summary: Represents a control that provides the user with a mechanism to perform an action.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IAction.ActionArgument
member.summary: Any argument associated with the action. The semantics of the value depend on the associated ActionName.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IAction.ActionName
member.summary: An indicator of what action was triggered. This is useful if a single control presents multiple actions to the user.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.UI.IAction.Action
member.summary: Raised when the action associated with a control is triggered through the user interface.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.ApplicationUnloadingEventArgs
member.summary: The event argument associated with the Unloading event of the application.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.ApplicationUnloadingEventArgs.SetUnloadPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the prompt to be displayed to user to confirm unloading of the page. The user is presented with a choice on whether to continue to unload the page, or stay on the page.
member.param: The prompt to be used.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.IStaticText
member.summary: Represents a control with text display semantics.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IStaticText.Text
member.summary: The text being displayed by the control.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.HistoryManager
member.summary: Provides the ability to implement a logical navigation journal that enables the use of back/forward browser buttons and enhanced bookmarkability.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.AddEntry(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified entry into the history journal.
member.param: A unique identifier for the history entry.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the History object.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.GoBack
member.summary: Navigates back in the history journal.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.GoForward
member.summary: Navigates forward in the history journal.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.IsEnabled
member.summary: Whether history functionality is enabled. History functionality requires underlying browser support which is not available across all browsers. This property can allow callers to determine if the history APIs are functional or not.

member.name: E:ScriptFX.HistoryManager.Navigated
member.summary: Raised when the user navigates the history journal with information about the history entry that is navigated to. It is also raised initially when the page loads with the current entry as set when loaded.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayOptions

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayOptions.fadeInOutInterval
member.summary: The duration over which the overlay is faded in and out. The default is 250ms. Set to 0 to disable the animated effect.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayOptions.id
member.summary: The name of the PopupBehavior to expose it as a top-level property of the element that the Behavior is associated with.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.OverlayOptions.opacity
member.summary: The opacity of the overlay when it is visible. It can be atmost 1, and should be greater than 0. By default it is set to 0.75.

member.summary: Creates and initializes an OverlayOptions object with the required set of properties.

member.summary: Whether the data being dragged can be dropped into the drop target.

member.summary: Called when the user drags the data being dragged out of the bounds of the drop target.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.IDropTarget.OnDragOver(ScriptFX.UI.DragDropData)
member.summary: Called while the user drags the data within the bounds of the drop target.
member.param: The information about the data being dragged.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.IDropTarget.DOMElement

member.summary: Creates an HTML color representation from the individual RGB components.

The green value (0 through 255)
The blue value (0 through 255)

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragMode.Move
member.summary: Indicates that the data being dragged is being moved from the drag source to the drop target.

member.name: F:ScriptFX.UI.DragMode.Copy

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList
member.summary: DOMEventList is a utility class to represent and manage a set of event handlers attached to a particular DOM element. In addition to attaching and detaching events, it can check if an event has been attached to, as well as provide an easy way to detach all event handlers which is useful at dispose-time.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList.#ctor(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Creates an instance of DOMEventList associated with the specified DOM element.
member.param: The DOM element associated with this event list.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList.Attach(System.String,System.DHTML.DOMEventHandler)
member.summary: Attaches an event handler to the specified event.
member.param: The event to attach the handler to.
The event handler that is to be notified when the event occurs.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList.Detach(System.String)
member.summary: Detaches the event handler associated with the specified event.
member.param: The event to detach from.
member.returns: true if a handler was detached; false if there was no handler.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes an event list, which disassociates it from its element, as well as detach all event handlers associated with the element.

member.name: M:ScriptFX.UI.DOMEventList.IsAttached(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if an event handler has been attached to the specified event.
member.param: The event to check for.
member.returns: true if a handler has been attached; false otherwise.

member.name: T:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationManager
member.summary: This class manages the set of active animations and is responsible for scheduling them, and executing them from start to finish. It allows advanced configuration of animations, such as the frames per second setting.

member.name: P:ScriptFX.UI.AnimationManager.FPS
member.summary: The number of frames per second to progress the animations over from start to finish.
